# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you write a function `wrap_string` in Julia that wraps text to a specified width. Here's an example function that meets your requirements:
```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)  # split the text into words
    current_line = ""
    lines = []

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            if!isempty(current_line)
                current_line *= " " * word
            else
                current_line = word
            end
        end
    end

    if!isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
